For Students

Enrollment Verifications

The Office of the Registrar reports enrollment for the current term after the add/drop period.  Your lender or loan provider should use the National Student Clearinghouse (NSC) to verify your enrollment for the purposes of deferring your loan and it is the lender’s responsibility to contact  the NSC for the most current information for each student.

If you need to provide enrollment verification for any other reason, you may request it by completing the form linked below 

    • Verification Request Form – Organizational login is required. 

 

Degree Verifications

You can request a verification of your degree verification using the options below.  

    • View your unofficial transcript or order your official transcript. 
    • Verification Request Form – Organizational login is required. Letter is only available to those who graduated within 1 year or are enrolled in their last classes. 
    • National Student Clearinghouse.  Information on how to do so can be found here: https://nscverifications.org/welcome-to-verification-services/ 

For Lenders, Employers, Background Screening Firms and Other Authorized Third Parties

Verifications

The National Student Clearinghouse is now authorized to provide degree and enrollment verifications on behalf of the University. The National Student Clearinghouse can be contacted at: 

https://nscverifications.org/welcome-to-verification-services/ 

National Student Clearinghouse
2300 Dulles Station Blvd, Suite 300
Herndon, VA 20171 

Or through their website: https://studentclearinghouse.org/contact/
